attributes.action: Recognise where the United Kingdom went wrong and set it right.
attributes.additional_details:
The Human Rights Act requires that our elections "Ensure the free expression of the opinion of the people in the choice of the legislature."
In 2016, elected representatives of the people expressed the clear opinion that they had no confidence in the then Leader of the Opposition.
That opinion was ignored.
This is where the nation stepped off the rails: parliament was in breach of the law.
We should wind back to that point, revoke everything they passed since, address the problem and try again.
attributes.background:
Britain used to command the respect of the world.
Our strength, stability & integrity was the envy of nations.
Over recent years that has changed.
We've become an international laughing stock, we're unstable, untrustworthy & untrusted.
Is our constitution broken or have we stepped away from it?

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
